description:
There are multiple places in nova where the binary of the nova api service is referred as 'nova-api'[1] but in fact the correct name of that binary is 'nova-osapi_compute' [2]


[1]https://github.com/openstack/nova/search?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=binary%3Dnova-api&type=
[2]https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/a818049554f61316930c7122bb0831b6372fadc0/api-guide/source/general_info.rst
title: nova notifications use nova-api as binary name instead of nova-osapi_compute

comments.content:
There are multiple places in nova where the binary of the nova api service is referred as 'nova-api'[1] but in fact the correct name of that binary is 'nova-osapi_compute' [2]


[1]https://github.com/openstack/nova/search?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=binary%3Dnova-api&type=
[2]https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/a818049554f61316930c7122bb0831b6372fadc0/api-guide/source/general_info.rst
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~balazs-gibizer

comments.content: I don't know how much this matters to fix honestly, are consumers actually correlating the binary to what's in the os-services REST API? If we did change these I'd think that would mean a versioned notification bump for any that are using this.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content: Since we don't know who is using this or how, I'd say we shouldn't change it. We could use this bug to enforce an enum for the possible binary values for notifications in nova so that we don't accidentally end up with both nova-api and nova-osapi_compute.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content:
Reviewed:  https://review.openstack.org/487126
Committed: https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/commit/?id=f468dae28a0a7bb547ca67dba667360bd1777c30
Submitter: Jenkins
Branch:    master

commit f468dae28a0a7bb547ca67dba667360bd1777c30
Author: Balazs Gibizer <email address hidden>
Date:   Tue Jul 25 16:46:26 2017 +0200

    rename binary to source in versioned notifications
    
    In the nova notification code path the nova service / binary names
    are hardcoded. There is a possible confusion as the REST API uses
    'nova-osapi_compute' while the notifications use 'nova-api'
    as the name of the nova compute service binary.
    
    To make it clear that these names used in the notifications
    are not the official service names the field storing it is renamed
    from 'binary' to 'source'. This renaming means that the version of
    NotificationPublisher ovo needed a major version bump. However this
    does not effect the consumers of the notifications as the
    NotificationPublisher is not directly serialized to the payload wire
    format. Instead the value  of the 'source' and 'host' fields are
    dumped into the publisher_id field of the notification envelope.
    Therefore this patch does not introduce a backward incompatible
    change from the notification consumer perspective.
    
    A subsequent patch will change this field to an enum to furter clarify
    the possible values for notifications.
    
    Change-Id: I95b5b0826190d396efe7bfc017f6081a6356da65
    Related-Bug: #1696152
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content:
Reviewed:  https://review.openstack.org/476538
Committed: https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/commit/?id=7c0132c5f4e12818cdc246760fc97e6667fc3aee
Submitter: Jenkins
Branch:    master

commit 7c0132c5f4e12818cdc246760fc97e6667fc3aee
Author: Balazs Gibizer <email address hidden>
Date:   Thu Jul 6 12:59:04 2017 +0200

    Use enum value instead of string service name
    
    In the nova notification code path the nova service / binary names
    are hardcoded. There is a possible confusion as the REST API uses
    'nova-osapi_compute' while the notifications use 'nova-api'
    as the name of the nova compute service binary.
    To avoid possible mixing of the names a new enum is introduced
    in the notification code path with the valid values form
    notification perspective.
    
    Change-Id: Ia85a8b6c34a3efaf3ef509aab316294b9c0c2fd1
    Closes-Bug: #1696152
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack
